suppress.notes: Karate does not expose the server docs in armeria-1.25.2.jar which contain the vulnerable package in file name: armeria-1.25.2.jar: main.680dc52304c22666afc6.js.gz: main.680dc52304c22666afc6.js
This code does not run a server so does not expose the HTTP/2 reset vulnerability
We do not use the affected reports and they do not accept date inputs so would not expose the vulnerability found in file: karate-core-1.5.0.RC1.jar: vis.min.js
This does not affect us as we are neither using the HotRod client nor writing our own custom Netty client with hostname validation disabled.
